results.title: Crumb
results.creator_credit: Superior Pictures, Lynn O'Donnell and Terry Zwigoff
results.brief_description: This surreal documentary about animator and director Robert Crumb was partly financed by David Lynch. Crumb was an underground counter-cultural comic artist who confronted taboos by examining sex, drugs and violence in his animated films and comics, most famously in “Fritz the Cat.” Crumb has continued to work in his anarchic manner but the collapse of the counterculture led to his increasing alienation and separation from the commercial art world. This documentary is confronting as an intimate study of an eccentric life, but it also reveals much about the nexus between imagination and personality, between family history and present relationships. Sometimes almost brutally naked, “Crumb” is an innovative study of a uniquely talented animator and comic. Winner of the Grand Jury Prize at the Sundance Film Festival.

results.title: Cruising
results.creator_credit: Jerry Weintraub, Lorimar Film Entertainment and William Friedkin
results.brief_description: On its initial release in 1980, “Cruising” was the target of criticism and protest by gay and lesbian activists who saw it as a negative and destructive portrayal of urban gay life. In retrospect, “Cruising” proves to be one of the most fascinating and chilling dramas about sexuality and violence to come out of Hollywood. Al Pacino plays Steve Burns, a heterosexual cop who has to go undercover in New York’s gay S/M subculture to uncover the identity of a serial killer who is murdering gay young men. As Burns becomes increasingly immersed in the highly sexualised world of gay S/M, he finds his own identity, centred on fixed definitions of gender and monogamous fidelity, challenged by the seductive allure of promiscuity, fast sex and drugs. As the film unfolds, his search for the killer becomes confused by the unleashing of his own repressed desires. Director Friedkin is known for his fast-paced and highly kinetic movies such as “The French connection” and “The Exorcist”, “Cruising” is equally taut and frightening. It is also a film which explores graphically the connections between violence, sexuality, homophobia and masculinity. Far from being a destructive portrayal of gay life, “Cruising” refuses neat sociological positive stereotyping and instead offers chilling insights into the aggressive desires of men, whatever their sexuality. Based on the novel by Gerald Walker.

results.title: Cruel intentions
results.creator_credit: Neal H. Moritz, Columbia Pictures and Roger Kumble
results.brief_description: Mercenary manipulator Kathryn, furious at being dumped for the painfully naive Cecile, plots revenge on her ex-boyfriend Court by goading her amoral step-brother Sebastian to seduce her and ruin her reputation. Sebastian is initially reluctant, revealing his interest in a more challenging potential conquest - the headmaster’s daughter Annette, who has vowed in a magazine article to forego sex before marriage. Undeterred, Kathryn proposes a more seductive wager: if Sebastian can successfully seduce Annette before school resumes in the fall, she will give him the one thing he has desperately desired since their parents got married… However, if he fails, then Kathryn gets to keep his most prized possession, a 1956 Jaguar Roadster. With the stakes so high, both of them are determined to win at all costs, leaving a trail of victims in their wake. It is only when their diabolical schemes take a few unexpected turns that they begin to realise the far-reaching consequences of their actions. Cruel Intentions is the fourth film adaptation of Les Liaisons Dangereuses, Choderlos de Laclos’ scandalous 1782 novel that portrayed sexual manipulation as an art form. Stars Sarah Michelle Gellar as Kathryn, Ryan Phillippe as Sebastian, Reese Witherspoon as Annette, and Selma Blair as Cecile.

results.title: Crucifixion: theme and variations
results.creator_credit: Filmmakers, George Jacobson, Mavis Lyons and J.H. Lenauer
results.brief_description: Interpretation by three Flemish artists, of the theme of the Crucifixion from the original paintings in the Johnson Collection at the Philadelphia Museum of Art. The following are studied: “Christ carrying the Cross” by the Master of the Turin Adoration (1490-1510); “Christ on the Cross and the Virgin and St. John” by Roger van der Weyden (1399-1464); and “Pieta” by Gerard David (1460-1523). Commentary by Murvyn Vye.

results.title: Crows and sparrows = Wuya yu maque [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Kunlun Film Company and Zheng Junli
results.brief_description: Production of this landmark film began in 1948 but was halted by the Kuomintang authorities when they discovered that the submitted script was not being followed and was heavily anti-KMT. In the interval before it resumed production in September 1949, it was rewritten to be even more hostile to KMT authorities. The film centres on the joys and disasters experienced by the inhabitants of a boarding house comandeered by a KMT official. The film’s basic form is derived from the modern drama tradition of China. The casual naturalism has been compared with neo-realism. Cast includes Zhao Dan, Wu Yin ans Sun Daolin. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Crown of righteousness
results.creator_credit: Ray Hoke, GHW Production and Norman Walker
results.brief_description: Paul’s captivity in Rome. Ephroditus bring him gifts from the Church in Phillippi. A reconstruction of the events relation to St Paul’s re-arrest and hie trial before Nero (2 Timothy IV 7-8).

results.title: Crow boy (K)
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios and Cynthia Freitag
results.brief_description: A shy boy attending a village school in Japan withdraws into a world of his own until a kind and wise teacher draws him out and his classmates discover his special talent. Based on the book of the same title by Taro Yashima.

results.title: Croupier
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Cavendish, Channel Four Films, Filmstiftung NRW, WDR La Sept Cinema, Arte and Mike Hodges
results.brief_description: Mike Hodges’ slow-burning “Croupier” is the tale of one man’s addiction to watching people lose; and whose detached observation of the sleaze and depression in the world of gambling becomes his only means of self-fulfillment. Jack Manfred (Clive Owen) is a former croupier and struggling writer lured back to casino work by his estranged father. Therein he encounters without any real surprise the business of letting people lose, and soon his relationships with those close to him take on a similar sense of self-interest and subtle cruelty. Interwoven with the robberies, intrigue and exoticism is a commentary on the alienation bred by gambling and the lifestyle it entails. Cast also includes Gina McKee, Kate Hardie and Paul Reynolds.

results.title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
results.creator_credit: Sony Pictures, Columbia Pictures, Good Machine International, EDKO Film, Zoom Hunt International, China Films Co-Production, Asian Union Film and Entertainment, Bill Kong, Ligong Xu and Ang Lee
results.brief_description: An epic love story and action drama set in China during the Qing dynasty, revolving around two sets of lovers. Li Mu Bai and Yu Shu Lien are duty bound warriors whose unspoken love spans decades. By comparison, their young romantic counterparts Jen Yu and Lo represent freedom, youth and unrestrained love.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Sony Pictures, Columbia Pictures, Good Machine International, EDKO Film, Zoom Hunt International, China Films Co-Production, Asian Union Film and Entertainment, Bill Kong, Ligong Xu and Ang Lee
results.description: An epic love story and action drama, set in China during the Qing dynasty, revolving around two sets of lovers. Li Mu Bai (Chow Yun Fat) and Yu Shu Lien (Michelle Yeoh) are cast as duty bound warriors whose unspoken love for each other spans decades. By comparison, their young romantic counterparts Jen Yu (a promising young warrior) and Lo (her bandit lover) represent freedom, youth and unrestrained love. After Li surrenders his legendary sword to Yu and vows to stop fighting, his plans to retire are halted when the sword is stolen. In their quest to recover it, Li and Yu confront the evil forces headed by Jade Fox who is attempting to recruit the impressionable young Jen Yu to her cause. As the opposing forces of good and evil battle to secure the sword, they also struggle to lure Jen Lu to their side. Based on an early 20th century novel by Wang Du Lu, the project was scripted by Wang Hui Ling, James Schamus and Tsai Kuo Jung. Photographed by Peter Pau. Martial arts choreography by Yuen Wo-Ping. (Awards: Academy Awards 2001, Best Foreign Film, Best Music Score, Best Art Direction and Best Cinematography)

(Awards: Academy Awards 2001, Best Foreign Film, Best Music Score, Best Art Direction and Best Cinematography)
